segments.source_content:
---
slug: /189
title: "This Week In React #189: Next.js Security, Memoization, useFormStatus, React State, Remix Typesafe Routes, View Transitions, Astro, Starlight, Hydrogen, Remotion, Lingui, Storybook, Skia Video, Starlink, App Clips, VisionOS..."
authors: [bndkt]
date: 06-12-2024
---
It's [Benedikt](https://x.com/bndkt) again this week, as Sebastien is taking a break.

translations.fr: C'est encore [Benedikt](https://x.com/bndkt) cette semaine, car S√©bastien prend une pause.
translations.en: C'est encore [Benedikt](https://x.com/bndkt) cette semaine, car Sebastien prend une pause.

segments.source_content: For me, the week's most interesting topics are not big announcements or new releases but rather subtle hints at future work (type-safe routes models coming to Remix, React Compiler coming to Expo, native intents in Expo Router), as well as some online discussions about React Suspense implementation details (`display: none`, and, more importantly, a pretty significant change in parallel fetching behavior with React 19).

translations.fr: Pour moi, les sujets les plus int√©ressants de la semaine ne sont pas des annonces majeures ou de nouvelles versions, mais plut√¥t des indices subtils sur les travaux futurs (les mod√®les de routes typ√©es qui arrivent dans Remix, le compilateur React qui arrive dans Expo, les intents natifs dans Expo Router), ainsi que des discussions en ligne sur les d√©tails d'impl√©mentation de React Suspense (`display: none`, et surtout un changement assez significatif dans le comportement de r√©cup√©ration parall√®le avec React 19).
translations.en: Pour moi, les sujets les plus int√©ressants de la semaine ne sont pas de grandes annonces ou nouvelles versions, mais plut√¥t des indices subtils sur les travaux futurs (mod√®les de routes typ√©es dans Remix, React Compiler dans Expo, intents natifs dans Expo Router), ainsi que des discussions en ligne sur les d√©tails d'impl√©mentation de React Suspense (`display: none`, et surtout un changement significatif dans le comportement de r√©cup√©ration parall√®le avec React 19).

segments.source_content: I watched this talk after hearing multiple people describing it as one of the best tech conference talks they‚Äôve ever seen. We‚Äôre at a very interesting point in time in web development, with React 19 bringing a major shift to the React model, new JS frameworks gaining popularity, and lots of online discussions drawing distinctions and/or making comparisons to Rails and Laravel. Ryan‚Äôs talk is a really good overview of how we got here and it offers, in my opinion, a very good mental model of how to think about React 19. Also fun to see one of the creators of Remix give a Next.js demo üòâ

translations.fr: J'ai regard√© cette conf√©rence apr√®s avoir entendu plusieurs personnes la d√©crire comme l'une des meilleures conf√©rences techniques qu'ils aient jamais vues. Nous vivons une p√©riode tr√®s int√©ressante dans le d√©veloppement web, avec React 19 apportant un changement majeur au mod√®le React, de nouveaux frameworks JS gagnant en popularit√©, et de nombreuses discussions en ligne √©tablissant des distinctions et/ou faisant des comparaisons avec Rails et Laravel. La conf√©rence de Ryan offre un tr√®s bon aper√ßu de comment nous en sommes arriv√©s l√† et propose, √† mon avis, un excellent mod√®le mental pour penser React 19. C'est aussi amusant de voir l'un des cr√©ateurs de Remix faire une d√©mo Next.js üòâ
translations.en: J'ai regard√© cette conf√©rence apr√®s avoir entendu plusieurs personnes la d√©crire comme l'une des meilleures qu'ils aient jamais vues. Nous vivons un moment fascinant du d√©veloppement web, avec React 19 apportant un changement majeur, de nouveaux frameworks JS gagnant en popularit√©, et de nombreuses discussions comparant ces approches √† Rails ou Laravel. La pr√©sentation de Ryan offre un excellent aper√ßu historique et, selon moi, un mod√®le mental pertinent pour appr√©hender React 19. Amusant aussi de voir un cr√©ateur de Remix faire une d√©mo Next.js üòâ

- üóì [React Summit](https://reactsummit.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - üá≥üá± Amsterdam - 14-18 June - Tickets are almost sold out. Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR".
- üìú [Weak memoization in JavaScript](https://dev.to/thekashey/weak-memoization-in-javascript-4po6): I really like those ‚Äúfundamental‚Äù articles. This is not about useMemo, it explains the concept of memoization from scratch (while referencing React a bunch), really helps to deepen the understanding of what‚Äôs going on under the hood.
- üìú [Creating a Reusable SubmitButton with useFormStatus](https://aurorascharff.no/posts/creating-a-reusable-submitbutton-with-useformstatus/): Following this article not only teaches you how to work with forms and server actions in React 19, but also how to do it using progressively enhanced forms.
- üìú [Lingui with React Server Components](https://lingui.dev/tutorials/react-rsc): Tutorial on how to internationalize a Next.js App Router app (incl. RSC) using Lingui.
- üìú [Next.js security checklist](https://blog.arcjet.com/next-js-security-checklist/): Useful checklist covering 7 areas, some very obvious (update dependencies, sanitize inputs), and others a bit more specific (avoid exposing server code, use security headers).
- üìú [Hydrogen - June 2024 Release - Optimistic cart, RichText component, stable analytics](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/update/june-2024): Apart from these three features announcements, the post starts with a repeated commitment to Remix (aka React Router 7), in case you were wondering.
- üìú [Astro - Starlight (the Astro-based documentation builder) turns one year old](https://astro.build/blog/starlight-turns-one/): Pretty impressive stats: 24 minor releases, 181 contributors, 2,000 commits, 4,000 GitHub stars, and 2,700 open-source Starlight sites.
- üìú [Astro - Zero-JavaScript View Transitions](https://astro.build/blog/future-of-astro-zero-js-view-transitions/): Chrome 126 just shipped support for native, app-like animations between page navigation.
- üìú [The Need for Speed: A Quick Way to Improve React Testing Times](https://www.helpscout.com/blog/improve-react-testing-times/)

- üìú [How to Build a Notification System in Next.js with Knock](https://spacejelly.dev/posts/how-to-build-a-notification-system-in-next-js-with-knock)
- üì¶ [Code Hike + Remotion example](https://github.com/code-hike/examples/tree/main/with-remotion): Neat combination to create animated code videos (üê¶ [Demo video](https://x.com/pomber/status/1800108854459715864?t=8ickNCn-Orou7665JY31VA&s=19)).
